section.p: Merging two dictionaries is only supported when you import an external dictionary into an existing one in .

When you do this, remember that the dictionary structure of the destination dictionary has precedence. You are warned if the dictionary structures differ, and allows you to create a new dictionary instead, to prevent any loss of data.

If, during dictionary merge, the same term exists in both dictionaries, the Merge Dictionary Entries window is displayed (see ). windowsMerge Dictionary Entries Merge Dictionary Entries windowFigure shows Merge Dictionary Entries window

section.title: Options and parameters

plentry.pd: Displays the term that exists in both dictionaries.
Contains the entries in the external dictionary for this term.
Contains the entries in the existing dictionary for this term.

Depending on how you want to process the entries for the current term (displayed in the two boxes), select one of the following options or click Cancel to stop the merging: Replace target entry with source entry This option only takes the source dictionary entry into consideration. The destination dictionary entry is overwritten. Ignore source entry This option only takes the destination dictionary entry into consideration. The source dictionary entry is discarded. Combine entries This option takes both the source dictionary and the destination dictionary entries into consideration, combining them to form one entry. Provided that the dictionary structures do not differ, no data is discarded or overwritten.

plentry.pt: Use the selected option for all entries
plentry.pd: Select this option, if you do not want the Merge Dictionary Entries window to appear every time the same term is found in both dictionaries and you are sure that your selected merge option applies for all entries.

section.p: Click Merge to begin or to continue the merging. Click Cancel to leave the merging and importing program.

section.title: Results
section.p: The external dictionary data is merged with the existing dictionary according to the specified options. The external dictionary is unchanged.
